Key Arguments: The definition of 'disinformation and misinformation' is excessively broad and lacks objective measures.
The legislation does not apply equally to all Australians, exempting government, institutional, and media entities.
The government/ACMA will have excessive control over electronic information, stifling dissent and democratic debate.
Main Themes: Concerns about broad and vague definitions
Inequality in application of the law
Potential for government overreach and censorship
Threats to democratic processes and free speech
Notable Quotes: This bill enshrines this propaganda power into law and if it becomes enacted will destroy the Australian democratic process.
This is rule by arbitrary decree! This is totally undemocratic and will destroy our democratic society.
Australia must not become a state that only allows a state-controlled narrative.
